Alankaras.name: Upamalarankara
Alankaras.definition: A figure of speech in which a comparison is made between two unlike objects using words like 'iva' (like, as).
examples: सीता इव चन्द्रकला, राम इव सूर्यतेजः (Sita is like the moonbeam, Rama is like the sun's radiance)
मेघ इव काले कम्बलिनी, वायु इव तीव्रगामिनी (Cloud is like a dark blanket, wind is like a swift runner)

Alankaras.name: AnuprasaAlankara
Alankaras.definition: A poetic device where the same or similar consonants are repeated in close proximity for emphasis.
examples: संगीते संगीतकुले संगीतप्रियदैवते (In the realm of music, in the divine abode of music, to the beloved deity of music)
सर्वांगसुन्दरी साध्वी साक्षात्पार्वतिरूपिणी (Auspicious and beautiful in every limb, truly the embodiment of Parvati)

Alankaras.name: AtisayoktiAlankara
Alankaras.definition: A figure of speech where an extraordinary quality of an object or subject is exaggerated.
examples: वायुः शीतो न भवति, विद्युत् शीतकरः न भवति (Wind is not cold, lightning is not chilly)
प्राणापानौ च पंचवायुसंस्थिता या भवेत् (The life breaths and the five vital airs are balanced)

Alankaras.name: YamakAlankara
Alankaras.definition: A figure of speech where a word or a phrase is repeated for emphasis or to create a poetic effect.
examples: वन्दे वन्दे जगत्-गुरौ वन्दे (I bow to the teachers of the world, I bow)
नीलाम्बरं नीलवपुषं पिताम्बराढ्यं विश्वेश्वरम् (I adore the Lord of the universe, dressed in blue attire)

Alankaras.name: RupakAlankara
Alankaras.definition: A figure of speech where a direct or indirect comparison is made using metaphorical language.
examples: देवदत्तः कान्तः खगः (Devadatta is a handsome person, like a bird)
चन्द्रमा यथा मुक्ताहारः (The moon is like a pearl necklace)

Alankaras.name: ShleshAlankara
Alankaras.definition: A figure of speech involving a combination of two different ideas, resulting in a harmonious and pleasing effect.
examples: वन्दे मातरम् (I bow to thee, Mother)
अग्नेः शिखायाम् आलोके विद्युत्तमा इवाम्भसा (In the flame of fire, shining like the best lightning in the sky)

Alankaras.name: UtprekshaAlankara
Alankaras.definition: A figure of speech where the expression is uplifted or intensified for greater impact.
examples: न देवासुरमानुषेषु विद्यते परमं स्थानम् (There is no higher place among gods, demons, and humans)

Alankaras.name: VakroktiAlankara
Alankaras.definition: A figure of speech where the expression is indirect, twisted, or deviates from the ordinary for artistic effect.
examples: सिद्धार्था गच्छन्ति गजाः (Elephants are going, meaning clouds are moving)

Alankaras.name: VilomAlankara
Alankaras.definition: A figure of speech where words are used in the opposite sense for emphasis or irony.

Alankaras.name: AnulomaAlankara
Alankaras.definition: A figure of speech where words are used in their natural or usual order for clarity.
examples: गङ्गा ताम्रपर्णीचा यमुना सरयू सिन्धु (Ganga, Tamraparni, Yamuna, Sarayu, Sindhu)

Alankaras.name: YamakAlankara
Alankaras.definition: A figure of speech where a word or a phrase is repeated for emphasis or to create a poetic effect.
examples: वन्दे वन्दे जगत्-गुरौ वन्दे (I bow to the teachers of the world, I bow)
नीलाम्बरं नीलवपुषं पिताम्बराढ्यं विश्वेश्वरम् (I adore the Lord of the universe, dressed in blue attire)
